comments.author: pietro.brenna@ginnasio.net
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110329 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110329 Firefox/4.2a1pre

Moving the new add on manager in an app tab by default could save space in the tab bar, and won't have any serious disadvantage in usability, because the only title displayed is "Add-ons Manager", quite redundant, as the user will always recognize the icon since it first activates add-ons manager.
This could also help to discover this new feature of Firefox.
The only disadvantage would be that it is more difficult to close the manager, but this could be solved adding a close button right in the manager.

Reproducible: Always

comments.author: blair@theunfocused.net
comments.text: At one stage, there was talk of being able to access the addons manager (and other in-content UI, like prefs) from within the home tab. As in, you'd be able to go to your home tab, and navigate to the addons manager (or prefs, etc) inside that tab, and back again. Not sure whatever came of that idea though.
